bibl.title: The Lost Phoenissae: An Experiment in Reconstruction from Fragments.
bibl.note: Explores two issues: the gaps and uncertainties that remain even when we have fairly ample fragments of a play, and the advances made possible by papyrological and other discoveries since the 1890s.

bibl.title: The Play of Texts and Fragments. Essays in Honour of Martin Cropp.

bibl.seg: Mastronarde Donald J., The Lost Phoenissae: An Experiment in Reconstruction from Fragments.
J.R.C. Cousland and James R. Hume (Edd.), The Play of Texts and Fragments. Essays in Honour of Martin Cropp = Mnemosyne. Supplementum 314 (Leiden, 2009) pp. 63-76.
Explores two issues: the gaps and uncertainties that remain even when we have fairly ample fragments of a play, and the advances made possible by papyrological and other discoveries since the 1890s.
